water-supply.text: Water supply doesn't meet demand (over a 3 day period)?
water-supply.help: Consider if your school's water supply is insufficient to meet basic needs over a 3-day period. This includes drinking water, sanitation, and other essential uses.

water-supply.text: Is there a back-up water supply nearby that can be made accessible?
water-supply.help: Is there an alternative water source (like a municipal connection, another well, or water delivery service) that could be accessed?

water-supply.text: Water supply meets demand (quantity of water) but isn't available from the source or the times when it's required?
water-supply.help: Is water available in sufficient quantity overall, but not when you need it? For example, intermittent municipal supply or seasonal water source variations.

water-demand.text: Are there flush toilets with cisterns?
water-demand.help: Does your school use conventional flush toilets that use a significant amount of water per flush?

water-demand.text: Are composting / dry toilets culturally feasible for this facility?
water-demand.help: Consider local cultural norms and acceptance. Would waterless toilet solutions be acceptable to students, staff, and the community?
Is water being used for gardens, sports fields, or other landscaping purposes?

dust-impacts.text: Is the ground surface within the facility site a source of dust? Is bare earth that turns to dust?
dust-impacts.help: Look for large areas of exposed soil within your school grounds that could be generating dust, especially during dry periods.

dust-impacts.text: Is there a main source of dust from outside of the facility? (e.g., an adjacent dirt road or a direction from which the dust comes?)
dust-impacts.help: Identify if dust is primarily coming from external sources like unpaved roads, construction sites, or agricultural fields.

dust-impacts.text: Is there at least 3m between the facility building and the source of the dust?
dust-impacts.help: Estimate the distance between your school buildings and the identified external dust source. Is there at least 3 meters (about 10 feet) of space?

dust-impacts.text: Are cooling and ventilation reduced when the openings are closed off to dust?
dust-impacts.help: When windows and doors are closed to prevent dust entry, does the building become significantly hotter or poorly ventilated?

dust-impacts.text: Is electrical supply capacity sufficient for AC?
dust-impacts.help: Does your school have adequate electrical infrastructure to support air conditioning systems?

dust-impacts.text: Is lighting insufficient when openings are closed off to dust?
dust-impacts.help: When windows are closed to prevent dust, do rooms become too dark for effective teaching and learning?

heat-impacts.help: Assess if direct sunlight hitting the exterior walls of the building is contributing to heat gain.
Determine if the east and west-facing walls are receiving direct sunlight, which can significantly increase heat gain.
Assess if south and north-facing walls are receiving direct sunlight throughout the day.
Consider external shading solutions for east and west walls to reduce direct sunlight exposure.
Extending roof overhangs can provide shading for walls, reducing heat gain.
Assess if direct sunlight entering through windows is causing indoor heating.
Consider external shading solutions for windows to reduce direct sunlight penetration.
Check if windows have glazing that helps control heat gain.

heat-impacts.text: Can glazing be improved with tinting?
heat-impacts.help: Consider whether adding window tinting could improve heat control.

heat-impacts.text: Is there a ceiling in good condition?
heat-impacts.help: Assess the condition of existing ceilings for potential heat insulation improvements.
Consider redesigning windows to better control solar heat gain.
Determine if significant heat gain is occurring through the roof structure.
Assess the structural integrity of the roof system.

heat-impacts.text: Are roof sheets in good condition?
heat-impacts.help: Check the condition of roof sheets or covering materials.
Identify the primary cause of roof structure issues.
Determine if locally available timber species are naturally resistant to insect damage.

heat-impacts.text: Is environmentally-friendly insect treatment available for timber?
heat-impacts.help: Check the availability of eco-friendly wood treatments for insect resistance.

rainwater-entry.help: Assess if rainwater is penetrating through the roof structure.
Evaluate the overall structural integrity of the roof system.

rainwater-entry.text: Are the roof sheets generally in good condition?
rainwater-entry.help: Inspect the roof sheets for damage, deterioration, or improper installation.

rainwater-entry.text: Is leaking only on the junction between sheets?
rainwater-entry.help: Determine if leaks are primarily occurring at the seams or junctions between roof sheets.

rainwater-entry.text: Is the gradient of the roof greater than 20 degrees?
rainwater-entry.help: Measure the slope of the roof to determine if it has adequate pitch for drainage.

rainwater-entry.text: Is the leaking only at the ridge?
rainwater-entry.help: Identify if leaks are concentrated along the ridge of the roof.

rainwater-entry.text: Is leaking in random, isolated locations?
rainwater-entry.help: Determine if leaks appear in scattered locations with no clear pattern.
Assess if rainwater penetration is occurring through windows.
Determine if leakage happens primarily during intense downpours with little wind.

rainwater-entry.text: Only during storm events when there are strong winds too?
rainwater-entry.help: Identify if leakage occurs mainly during windy rainstorms.

rainwater-entry.text: Does water get in under the bottom of the window?
rainwater-entry.help: Check if water is penetrating beneath the window sill or bottom frame.
Assess if rainwater is entering beneath doorways.

rainwater-entry.text: Does the floor ground in front of the door rise from the building away from the floor?
rainwater-entry.help: Check if the ground slopes toward the building instead of away from it.

rainwater-entry.text: Is there a step of at least 1" (25mm) at the door that's visible and usable and raised?
rainwater-entry.help: Determine if doorways have an adequate threshold to prevent water entry.

flood-management.text: The source of flood waters are external to the site
flood-management.help: Determine if flooding originates from beyond the school grounds.

flood-management.text: Is there a local drainage system with channels etc. in place where floodwater can be diverted into?
flood-management.help: Assess if local drainage infrastructure exists that could be utilized.

flood-management.text: Is there space on the site for water collection (run away)?
flood-management.help: Evaluate if the site has adequate space for water detention or retention areas.

flood-management.text: Water collection
flood-management.help: Consider implementing water collection solutions.

flood-management.text: Drainage within the site is insufficient to drain rainwater
flood-management.help: Assess if on-site drainage systems are inadequate for managing rainwater.

flood-management.text: Is there a local drainage system nearby where surface runoff rainwater can be diverted into?
flood-management.help: Determine if existing drainage infrastructure is available near the site.

flood-management.text: Floods wash away soils from under buildings or damage them from floods
flood-management.help: Assess if flooding is causing soil erosion or structural damage to buildings.

flood-management.text: Can the floor level of the building be raised?
flood-management.help: Evaluate if it's feasible to elevate building floor levels above flood elevation.

flood-management.text: Does the floor drain out of the building?
flood-management.help: Determine if water that enters the building can drain out easily.

flood-management.text: Are electrical sockets and switches at least 1" above the floor?
flood-management.help: Check if electrical fixtures are positioned at a safe height above potential flood levels.

flood-management.text: Water supply becomes contaminated during flooding
flood-management.help: Assess if flood events compromise water quality.

flood-management.text: Is water source at least 10m away from toilet areas or waste facilities (solid waste)?
flood-management.help: Determine if adequate separation exists between water sources and potential contamination sources.

flood-management.text: Waste (rubbish) blocks drainage system
flood-management.help: Assess if solid waste is impeding drainage systems.

flood-management.text: Is there a system for removing rubbish from the facility site?
flood-management.help: Determine if waste management systems are in place.

flood-management.text: Is there sufficient storage capacity for waste at the facility?
flood-management.help: Evaluate if adequate waste storage capacity exists on site.

flood-management.text: Is upslope storage protected from severe winds and storms?
flood-management.help: Assess if waste storage areas are secure during extreme weather.

flood-management.text: Sewage system / foul water drainage - problems
flood-management.help: Assess issues with sewage or foul water drainage systems.

flood-management.text: Are the toilets above flood levels?
flood-management.help: Determine if toilet facilities are positioned above potential flood levels.

flood-management.text: Is there vehicle access to septic tanks for emptying?
flood-management.help: Assess if maintenance vehicles can access septic systems.

flood-management.text: Is septic tank of sufficient volume for usage?
flood-management.help: Evaluate if septic tank capacity is adequate for the facility's needs.

flood-management.text: Are the lids and manholes for the system above flood water levels?
flood-management.help: Check if system access points are positioned above flood levels to prevent infiltration.

flood-management.text: Can the site facility be subjected to flash floods?
flood-management.help: Assess vulnerability to rapid-onset flooding events.

flood-management.text: Is there a safe escape route from the facility site (leading to higher land)?
flood-management.help: Identify evacuation routes to higher elevation areas.

wildfire-impacts.help: Assess how wildfire smoke affects indoor air quality at the facility.

wildfire-impacts.text: Reducing risk of fires spreading onto site
wildfire-impacts.help: Evaluate preventive measures to protect the site from approaching wildfires.
Assess evacuation procedures and infrastructure in case of wildfires.
Identify designated evacuation routes protected from fire exposure.
Ensure emergency vehicles can access the facility during wildfire events.

wildfire-impacts.text: Roads to site accessible by fire truck?
wildfire-impacts.help: Evaluate if fire trucks can reach the facility via existing roads.

wildfire-impacts.text: Fire truck can get to within 90m of buildings (also on hoisty ground)?
wildfire-impacts.help: Determine if fire trucks can get close enough to buildings for effective firefighting.

wildfire-impacts.text: Reducing spread on site / damage to buildings
wildfire-impacts.help: Implement measures to prevent fire spread on site and minimize building damage.
Ensure proper protection of fuel and gas storage areas from fire exposure.
Select and maintain fire-resistant building materials.

wildfire-impacts.text: Is there a water supply for fire fighting?
wildfire-impacts.help: Ensure adequate water supply is available for firefighting purposes.

wildfire-impacts.text: Is the route to and from this supply protected from fire?
wildfire-impacts.help: Ensure access to water supply remains available during fire events.

electricity-supply.help: Evaluate options for enhancing electricity supply to the facility.
Consider implementing solar photovoltaic systems for electricity generation.

electricity-supply.text: National grid supply is either unavailable or unreliable
electricity-supply.help: Assess limitations of the existing electrical grid connection.

electricity-supply.text: Is electricity required during hours of darkness?
electricity-supply.help: Determine if nighttime electricity demand exists at the facility.
Implement strategies to lower overall electricity consumption.

electricity-supply.text: Are energy-efficient or passive water heaters used to heat water?
electricity-supply.help: Assess current water heating systems for energy efficiency.
Evaluate if energy-efficient equipment and appliances are in use.

electricity-supply.text: Are electric fans and / or AC systems used to maintain comfortable internal temperatures?
electricity-supply.help: Assess current cooling strategies and their energy consumption.
Determine if refrigeration is necessary for facility operations.

electricity-supply.text: Is artificial lighting required during daylight hours?
electricity-supply.help: Evaluate daytime lighting needs and potential natural light utilization.
Assess inadequacies in natural lighting within the facility.

electricity-supply.text: Can the number, size and location of windows and doors be improved?
electricity-supply.help: Evaluate potential improvements to fenestration for better daylighting.

electricity-supply.text: Can window reveals and internal walls be painted white?
electricity-supply.help: Consider light-colored surfaces to enhance light reflection.
Evaluate if light shelves could improve daylight penetration deeper into spaces.
Assess issues with excessive brightness or contrast causing visual discomfort.

electricity-supply.text: Does sunlight enter the building through windows?
electricity-supply.help: Determine if direct sunlight penetration is causing glare issues.

electricity-supply.text: Are the windows / sources of light evenly distributed?
electricity-supply.help: Evaluate the distribution of light sources throughout the space.

electricity-supply.text: Are there reflective / white surfaces next to the building?
electricity-supply.help: Identify if external reflective surfaces are contributing to glare problems.

air-quality.help: Assess external air quality issues affecting the facility.

air-quality.text: Source of air pollution are outside of the boundary of the facility site?
air-quality.help: Determine if air pollution originates from beyond the site boundaries.

air-quality.text: Exhaust from generators / sources of outdoor air pollution contribute to poor air quality
air-quality.help: Identify specific external pollution sources affecting air quality.
Determine if on-site generators are necessary for facility operations.

air-quality.text: Fumes from generators / sources of outdoor air pollution contribute to poor air quality
air-quality.help: Assess the impact of exhaust fumes from generators or other external sources.

air-quality.text: Can screens / trees be added to protect the facility from sources of air pollution?
air-quality.help: Evaluate if natural barriers can help filter or block air pollutants.
Determine if on-site generators are necessary for facility operations.

air-quality.text: Install generator with better air quality output
air-quality.help: Consider upgrading to generators with cleaner emissions.
Assess internal air quality issues within the facility.

air-quality.text: The source of poor quality air is external
air-quality.help: Determine if poor indoor air quality stems from external sources.

air-quality.text: Air quality is affected by WASH facilities?
air-quality.help: Assess if water, sanitation, and hygiene facilities are contributing to air quality issues.

air-quality.text: Poor air quality is due to build-up of CO2?
air-quality.help: Determine if carbon dioxide buildup from occupants is the main air quality concern.

air-quality.text: Poor air quality is due to internal man-made building materials?
air-quality.help: Identify if building materials are off-gassing and affecting air quality.

air-quality.text: Poor air quality is due to dampness and mold?
air-quality.help: Assess if moisture issues are causing mold and affecting air quality.

air-quality.text: Is external air quality the same throughout the site?
air-quality.help: Determine if air quality varies across different areas of the site.

air-quality.text: Supply for ventilation and cooling system at the part of building with 'cleaner' air
air-quality.help: Consider strategic placement of ventilation intakes in areas with better air quality.

rec_make_accessible.text: Make water source accessible. Ensure the backup water supply can be easily accessed when needed.

rec_drill_borehole.text: Drill borehole to access groundwater. This provides a reliable water source independent of municipal supply.

rec_increase_storage.text: Increase water storage capacity. Install additional tanks to store water when it's available for use during periods of shortage.

rec_reduce_flush.text: Reduce flush capacity. Install water-saving devices in toilet cisterns to reduce water usage per flush.

rec_composting_toilets.text: Install composting toilets to reduce water demands. These systems require little to no water and can provide fertilizer for non-food plants.

rec_grey_water.text: Install grey water recycling system. Reuse water from handwashing and other clean sources for irrigation.

rec_plant_vegetation.text: Plant drought-resistant vegetation and trees to prevent soil erosion within the site. This will stabilize the soil and reduce dust while ensuring ventilation and cooling aren't affected.

rec_external_screen.text: Install external screens or barriers to shield buildings from dust source. This could include fencing with climbing plants or purpose-built dust screens.

rec_infrastructure.text: Invest in infrastructure adjacent to site - e.g., paving dirt roads, planting vegetation buffers, or installing dust suppression systems.

rec_ventilation_openings.text: Amend or add openings to allow ventilation while preventing dust entry. Install screened windows or vents positioned to maximize airflow while minimizing dust infiltration.

rec_ac_systems.text: Consider installation of AC systems to maintain comfortable temperatures while keeping windows closed during dusty periods.

rec_artificial_lighting.text: Increase artificial lighting. Install energy-efficient lighting systems to compensate for closed windows during dusty periods.

rec_heat_wall_facing.text: Consider heat reflection materials for wall and wall facing areas

rec_paint_ceiling.text: Add ceiling at high level with insulation on top

rec_cool_roof.text: Cool roof shingles/sheet metal/white painted galvanized

rec_ventilate_roof.text: Ventilate roof (lift ridge tiles out of mortar)

rec_insulate_roof.text: Insulate roof: sheep's wool or recycled plastic or straw

rec_storm_roof.text: Re-build roof with particular attention to truss design and roofage

rec_rotten_roof.text: Re-build roof with particular attention to preventing rafter ingress

rec_disrepaired_roof.text: Re-build roof with particular attention to weathering exposure

rec_insect_roof.text: Re-build roof with particular attention to tying down and fixings

rec_treatment_roof.text: Re-build roof with particular attention to treating wood and fixings

rec_reposition_sheets.text: Re-position sheets with overlap of at least 6" (150mm)

rec_correct_structure.text: Correct structure to increase gradient to at least 20 degrees

rec_add_awnings.text: Add awnings to windows (where applied as may)

rec_add_drainage.text: Add drain to protect / slope in front of doors draining away from door / building

rec_terminal_drainage.text: Terminal drainage channels at the site boundaries to point water flow away

rec_infrastructure_project.text: Larger infrastructure project required adjacent to the site

rec_improve_drainage.text: Improve drainage channels on site to allow faster run-off

rec_electrical_protection.text: Move electrical sockets and switches OR build defensive at doorways OR Provision of power boots and floors from wall damage

rec_drainage_clearing.text: Drainage system enlarged beneath facility needs to be in place before facility interventions will be effective

rec_protect_storage.text: Protect storage that is protected from wind, floods and animals

rec_add_access.text: Add raised access for maintenance vehicle access

rec_early_warning.text: Early warning system: go to recommendations

rec_escape_routes.text: Escape route from buildings to the boundary

rec_grid_connection.text: National grid supply is reliable but too expensive to use

rec_efficient_devices.text: Replace electrical devices for energy efficient models

rec_temperature_guidance.text: Follow guidance on 'temperature is a problem'

rec_efficient_lighting.text: Layout and energy efficient bulbs and automatic operation

rec_replace_materials.text: Replace man-made materials with natural materials

rec_remove_materials.text: Remove materials that are inappropriate / reduce drying out
